rev.comment: Statement about MMOGs removed; it is counterfactual since MMOGs are a superset of MMORPGs.
That's the original MUD, which was named MUD.
/* History */ A MUD. There were multiple MUDs, not just one.

one of the newest and upcoming largest games out there is EVE-Online. Belived it needed added in for its almost as big as wow.
the comment about "not actually roleplaying" is mentioned later in article, and is not important enough info for the introduction
"Massive(ly)" is used to describe the large number of players; the size of the game would be too arbitrary.
reword header to eliminate confusion w/References section
/* References in Pop Culture */ Merging repetitive list.

Reverted 1 edit by [[Special:Contributions/Patriarch|Patriarch]]; Addition to intro doesn't help, nor does removal of link to glossary. using [[WP:TW|TW]]
/* Social interaction */ removed some over-specific, and boring, details. fixed some sentence structure.
/* Trends as of 2007 */ added a link to "[[Warhammer Fantasy Battle]]"
Reverted [[WP:AGF|good faith]] edits by [[Special:Contributions/81.175.86.66|81.175.86.66]]. using [[Wikipedia:WikiProject User scripts/Scripts/Twinkle|Twinkle]]
/* Themes */ there may be a soccer mmorpg, but it is not a recognizable literary genre
Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/70.48.214.225|70.48.214.225]] to last version by 76.216.30.145
/* Progression */ removed commenting on fair use, I have updated it and think it applies, if you disagree please use my talk page for further discussion
also trashing the line about MU*s in the introduction; MMORPGs aren't *defined* as being *not* text-based games, and some of those games may in fact be MMORPGs. Information about them goes in History
can get rid of the "Blogger Tobold" line in the introduction (wouldn't be appropriate even if "Tobold" was a popular figure), since the same information appears later in "Common features"
replaced large swaths of article cut out by 144.15.255.227; uncited text may still be valuable and should not be removed before being challenged. challenge on the talk page!
/* History */ rem lots of uncited OR
attribute questionable statement to its source within the article

replacing uncited commentary. plenty of this article is uncited; citing only needs to occur when material is challenged.
/* Social roles */ relating caption to section
/* Progression */ image needs better Fair use rationale
/* Culture */ threw in a paragraph on grinding in culture
replaced main picture with the older one; features a much more significant game (though I never played it), and much better illustrates the social gameplay
damage repair; restored "Economics", made new section in "Common Themes"
